title: What's News --  World-Wide
text:
Derek Chauvin was convicted of three counts, including murder charges, in the death of George Floyd, a Black man whose death while in police custody was captured on video that set off unrest over law enforcement's treatment of people of color.

---

Europe's health agency said a warning about unusual blood clots should be added to the product information of the J&J Covid-19 vaccine, but that the benefits of taking the shot outweigh the risks.

---

Russia has moved warplanes to Crimea and bases near Ukraine to an extent greater than previously disclosed, according to commercial-satellite photos.

---

Biden told a group of lawmakers that he intends to propose a temporary extension of an enhanced child tax credit, rebuffing requests from some Democrats who favor making the benefit permanent.

---

Soaring carbon emissions are on track to reverse a big chunk of last year's sharp reduction, with energy demand increasing as countries restart their economies.

---

Chad's president, Idriss Deby, died after sustaining injuries in clashes between rebels and government troops outside the capital.

---

The breakaway Super League that aimed to reshape the European soccer landscape collapsed as six of the proposed circuit's 12 elite clubs pulled out of the project.

---

China and the U.S. are close to naming new envoys to their respective capitals.
